author: WSJ Staff
title: WSJ Wealth Adviser Briefing: Nest Eggs, Notes, $275 Jeans
text: Some U.S. cities are learning something this year from Amazon: how to sell themselves, writes Keiko Morris and Laura Stevens. Many of the 20 cities shortlisted as sites for the retail giant’s second headquarters are using the multimedia presentations they created for ’s application to pitch to other companies. Below, some of the best analysis Fired-Up Coal Rivals Oil’s Rise Next Rising Crude Prices Tempt Shale Oil Producers to Branch Out—Energy Journal
